title: Calories in India Pale Ale
meta_description: Discover calories in India Pale Ale per standard serving, including carbs, alcohol content, and nutrition breakdowns for popular IPAs.
assumptions: Standard 12 fl oz (355 ml) serving of India Pale Ale (IPA) at ~6.5% ABV, unfiltered or filtered craft beer style, no added sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, ABV, brewing method, and serving size. Check labels or brewery info for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard 12 fl oz India Pale Ale contains about 220 calories, mostly from alcohol and carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with beer packaging.

tweaks.label: Switch to a session IPA (lower 4.5% ABV)
Opt for a double IPA (higher 8% ABV)

faqs.q: How many calories in a standard India Pale Ale?
faqs.a: About 220 kcal in a 12 fl oz serving of typical IPA.

faqs.q: What contributes most to calories in India Pale Ale?
faqs.a: Primarily alcohol (~6.5% ABV) and fermentable carbs from malt, totaling ~18 g carbs.

faqs.q: Does India Pale Ale have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Minimal: ~1.5 g protein and 0 g fat per 12 fl oz.

faqs.q: How does ABV affect calories in IPA?
faqs.a: Higher ABV increases calories; a 4.5% session IPA has ~160 kcal vs. 220 for 6.5%.

faqs.q: Are there low-calorie India Pale Ale options?
faqs.a: Yes, light or low-carb IPAs range from 100-150 kcal per serving.
